rdf:Description.odef:name: O-DEF
rdf:Description.odef:description: Metadata used to describe the O-DEF itself.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Enterprise-Operation
rdf:Description.odef:description: Metadata used to describe the basic operation of an enterprise.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Purchase
rdf:Description.odef:description: Metadata used to describe a purchase of goods or services.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Person
rdf:Description.odef:description: A human being, whether man, woman, or child.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Male
rdf:Description.odef:description: A male person.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Female
rdf:Description.odef:description: A female person.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Enterprise
rdf:Description.odef:description: A collection of people organized to achieve a common set of goals.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Resource
rdf:Description.odef:description: A source or supply from which benefit is produced. Typically resources are materials, energy, services, knowledge, or other assets that are transformed, used or consumed to produce benefit and in the process may be consumed or made unavailable.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Location
rdf:Description.odef:description: A place or position. Typically locations provide geographic context that characterizes the data element.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Event
rdf:Description.odef:description: An occurrence happening at a determinable time or times, with or without the participation of human agents.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Condition
rdf:Description.odef:description: A particular mode of being of a person or thing; existing state; situation with respect to circumstances.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Environment
rdf:Description.odef:description: The natural or man-made surroundings of someone or something.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Law-Rule
rdf:Description.odef:description: A law (natural or man-made) or policy that governs a process.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Process
rdf:Description.odef:description: A series of actions, changes, or functions bringing about a result.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Product
rdf:Description.odef:description: The result of a process.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Substance
rdf:Description.odef:description: A material of a particular kind.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Information-Set
rdf:Description.odef:description: A collection of information, whether in physical form (such as a book), machine-readable form (such as a file on disc), or human-based form (such as a person’s recollection or an oral tradition).

rdf:Description.odef:name: Identifier
rdf:Description.odef:description: A value that is intended to identify uniquely the object of the data element. Example identifiers are social security numbers, automobile Vehicle Identification Numbers (VINs), drivers’ license numbers, engineering drawing numbers, and part serial numbers. A name can be an identifier in some contexts, but names are usually not used as identifiers because they are often not unique.

rdf:Description.odef:name: URI
rdf:Description.odef:description: A Uniform Resource Identifier as defined in RFC 3986.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Name
rdf:Description.odef:description: A word or phrase that refers to the object of the data element but is not intended to identify it uniquely. Name is a specialized form of Text.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Family
rdf:Description.odef:description: A name shared by the people in a family.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Given
rdf:Description.odef:description: A name given to a person, as distinguished from an inherited family name.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Code
rdf:Description.odef:description: A value from an enumerated list of possible values that is not an Indicator and that is not subject to continual change. Example codes are telephone area codes, postal zip codes, and country codes.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Language
rdf:Description.odef:description: A code that indicates a particular human language.

rdf:Description.odef:name: RFC-4646
rdf:Description.odef:description: A language tag structured and registered as described in RFC 4646.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Country
rdf:Description.odef:description: A code that indicates a country.

rdf:Description.odef:name: ISO-3166
rdf:Description.odef:description: A code as defined by ISO 3166.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Alpha-2
rdf:Description.odef:description: A two-letter country code.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Alpha-3
rdf:Description.odef:description: A three-letter country code.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Numeric
rdf:Description.odef:description: A three-digit country code.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Indicator
rdf:Description.odef:description: A value that is one of only two (true or false) possible choices. Example indicators are temperature high, pressure low, and power on.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Measure
rdf:Description.odef:description: A numeric quantity that has an explicit or implied unit of measure other than a monetary unit. Example units of measure are miles, degrees centigrade, liters, and meters.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Temperature
rdf:Description.odef:description: A temperature.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Centigrade
rdf:Description.odef:description: A temperature measured in degrees centigrade.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Fahrenheit
rdf:Description.odef:description: A temperature measured in degrees Fahrenheit.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Quantity
rdf:Description.odef:description: An integral numeric quantity that has no unit of measurement. Examples are the quantity ordered of a product or the number of items in stock.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Amount
rdf:Description.odef:description: An explicit or implied monetary unit of measure. Example monetary units are Euros, British pounds, US dollars, and Canadian dollars.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Rate
rdf:Description.odef:description: A real (in the mathematical sense) numeric quantity, possibly expressed as a fraction, but not as a percentage. For example, a divorce rate of 10 marriages per 1000 is a Rate.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Percent
rdf:Description.odef:description: A numeric quantity expressed as a percentage. Percent is a specialized Rate. If the above divorce rate was expressed as one marriage per hundred, it would be a Percent. Another example Percent is an interest rate on a loan.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Date
rdf:Description.odef:description: A specific date in the progression of time. An example is date-of-birth expressed as year + month + day.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Date-Time
rdf:Description.odef:description: A specific date plus time in the progression of time. An example is the date and time at which a patient’s temperature is taken, expressed as year + month + day + hour + minute. Other examples might specify time more or less precisely; for example, with seconds and microseconds, or without minutes.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Time
rdf:Description.odef:description: A specific time within a specific timeframe. For example, day of month, hour of day, and minute of hour might be used to specify when a regular meeting repeats.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Text
rdf:Description.odef:description: Text that is not an identifier, name, code, indicator, measure, quantity, amount, rate, percent, date, date-time, or time. Examples are descriptions of products offered for sale, the text of contracts, and passwords.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Content
rdf:Description.odef:description: The text of the object of the data element. For example, the text of a book.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Description
rdf:Description.odef:description: Text that describes the object of the data element.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Binary
rdf:Description.odef:description: A value that is not an identifier, name, code, indicator, measure, quantity, amount, rate, percent, date, date-time, time, or text.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Graphic
rdf:Description.odef:description: A binary object that is a diagram, graph, mathematical curve, or similar representation.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Picture
rdf:Description.odef:description: A binary object that is a visual representation of a person, object, or scene.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Sound
rdf:Description.odef:description: A binary object that is capable of creating audio.

rdf:Description.odef:name: Video
rdf:Description.odef:description: A binary object that is capable of creating motion pictures.
